TopicTitle: Uhh new sp+ parts turn back into old parts

Articles.Content: The new structural wing turns back into the wing connecter...

EDIT:

Nah, this is easier:

Did you use patcher?

If so,

do the following steps:

1. Go into /KSPDIR/GameData/Squad

2. Erase Parts folder.

3. Run patcher.

4. Restart Game.

5. Enjoy single items.

Reason:

They changed Part Config names, so the part.cfg is still there.

So this worked for me.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95820-Double-parts-%28with-fix%29

Edited October 8, 2014 by slumpie

EDIT:

Nah, this is easier:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95820-Double-parts-%28with-fix%29

Did that to fix double parts my wing connector A turned into a wing connector like the older one.

Delete the entire KSP directory. have NO KSP on said computer. Redownload from ur purchased location, i.e. KSP Store or Steam. Run KSP after downloading. If there is still a problem with the parts after you have done this, than post back here with logs and the crafts you are creating that does this.

Cheers,

ToTheMun

Delete the entire KSP directory. have NO KSP on said computer. Redownload from ur purchased location, i.e. KSP Store or Steam. Run KSP after downloading. If there is still a problem with the parts after you have done this, than post back here with logs and the crafts you are creating that does this.

Cheers,

ToTheMun

The patcher method described above, just removing the old parts, does work and involves a far smaller download. The Squad patcher is basically a pretty front end to rsync, so it'll only download what it needs.

The downside being that if you use the patcher without deleting the old parts directory, rsync will just happily plonk all the new parts next to the old parts. Whups.

The patcher method described above, just removing the old parts, does work and involves a far smaller download. The Squad patcher is basically a pretty front end to rsync, so it'll only download what it needs.

The downside being that if you use the patcher without deleting the old parts directory, rsync will just happily plonk all the new parts next to the old parts. Whups.

he said he has already tried the patcher re-download install thingy above and it didn't work. the complete delete and re-download nearly always fixes any of these problems. Happened to me once before, and the patcher didn't fix it so I redownloaded it and it worked. just saying XD

That's because if you only delete the Parts folder, there may still be other bits lying around. You need to delete more than just that, so completely deleting KSP will work. Or you can just delete the contents of the GameData folder.

Cheers,

~Claw
For some reason deleting sp+ parts and parts folder then running patched works...
